title: Research Topic: Engineering Institutional Resilience Against Capture
summary: Based on the research priority 'Engineering Institutional Resilience Against Capture', this event represents a significant development in the area described as: Research how systems engineering principles can be applied to design more resilient democratic institutions that resist capture, corruption, and authoritarian manipulation.... This event demonstrates the interconnected nature of global kleptocracy and corruption networks, involving multiple actors across jurisdictions and highlighting the need for coordinated international response.
